title: Douce
occurrences: Thank you, Douce. But I don't think I could play with a boat any more.
- I was having tea with Douce, as usual. - No, Irene, not as usual.
Today was your last tea with Douce.
That was the last toast you buttered for Mlle Douce de Bonafe.
Douce! What are you doing here?
- May I borrow your window? - Of course, Douce, but why?
I wish Douce had shown an interest in my library.
But Douce never has the time. Why not?
Apart from Douce, perhaps. Otherwise...
Her name was Gravelotte. She would have been Douce's age.
- Is there nothing you'd like? - I go out often with Douce...
Douce is next door. She can hear everything.
Mademoiselle Douce!
Congratulations, Douce. You've woken the whole house.
All this finery to take Douce to the circus!
- I don't like that. What is it? - I'd like Irene to accompany Douce.
while you and Douce go off and watch your acrobats,
- Douce will be so disappointed. - Thank you, M Count.
Douce wanted a big one for her last childhood Christmas.
Are you ready, Douce? Mlle Irene won't be coming.
Yes, Douce, there's something. You don't like her.
- Jealous, Douce? - Jealous of whom?
What's the matter, Douce? Say something!
Will you answer me? Enough, Douce!
But Douce, are you in favour of this marriage?
I have some news. I've seen Douce. It seems you have an ally.
Douce accepts you as step-mother.
- Very well then... - Douce!
- Take her into the hall. - Douce, my dear, what is it?
Go away, Douce. When I've finished packing, I'm going to your father.
You're very pretty, Douce. And, as you said, no longer a child.
- Douce, you chose a bad day for this. - I didn't choose the day. It's the last.
No, Douce. I'd never marry a rich girl, even if I loved her.
Douce, put that down.
Douce, it's time for bed!
Douce, where are you going?
No, Douce. It's just a quality of the mirror.
I wish I could take you to a palace, Douce.
Douce, I want to ask you a question. Then I'll never ask it again.
- My little Douce, I... - No. Not yet. Tell me tomorrow.
- Good night, little Douce. - Good night.
I need Douce. That's all.
- I'll discuss it with my husband. - Douce, please, stop this game!
- I think Mlle came to separate us. - Douce!
- My lover. - Why did you lie, Douce?
Coming, Douce?
Mlle Douce says she'll come back tonight. But no-one's to know.
Douce! Where are you?
Please, Douce, don't stare like that. It's bad manners.
Oh no, Douce! I love you when you're foolish.
But until midnight, it's Douce who gives the orders.
As you wish, my darling. Until midnight, Douce gives the orders.
I'm not thinking of myself, but of Douce, who's coming back.
I want us to see her not as the Douce who left, but as Douce who came home.
Douce! Are you far away? What are you thinking about?
- Douce, calm yourself. - Oh, I'm terribly calm.
- Let me go. They're waiting for me. - Douce, let's talk sensibly.
- Douce, what about this morning? - I don't regret this morning.
But you'll realise that she's nothing, compared to Douce.
Your life has been cut in two. Before Douce, and after Douce.
Douce?
To see that! To see Douce dead before me!
Well, you've something to laugh about now. Douce is dead.
Douce! Where's Douce? Bring her to me.
